alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Marion County through 815 PM EDT... At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lisbon to 8 miles west of Wildwood. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, penny size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocala, Juniper Springs, Weirsdale, Santos, Ocklawaha, Moss Bluff, Ocala Airport, Silver Springs Shores, Lake Weir and Belleview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Marion; Eastern Marion; Western Marion
